gain_delta.name: GAIN Index, adjusted for GDP
gain_delta.description: GDP adjusted GAIN Index scores represent how much better or worse the actual GAIN Index score is from its expected value, based on its GDP. A positive value means a country has a better GAIN Index score than other countries of a similar GDP. A negative value means a country has a worse score.
gain_delta.map_caption: Countries of the world by GAIN Index, adjusted for GDP. Higher scores are better.
gain_delta.ranking_caption: World wide ranking by GAIN Index, adjusted for GDP. Higher scores are better.

gain.name: GAIN Index
gain.description: The GAIN Index captures a country's Vulnerability to climate change and other global challenges, and its Readiness to improve resilience.
gain.map_caption: Countries of the world by their position on the GAIN Index.
gain.ranking_caption: World wide ranking by GAIN Index, higher scores are better.

matrix.name: GAIN Matrix
matrix.description: The Readiness Matrix illustrates the comparative resilience of countries. The vertical axis measures the relative vulnerability of countries. The horizontal axis measures to what degree a country is ready to deal with climatic and environmental changes.
matrix.map_caption: Countries of the world by their quadrant position on the GAIN Index.
matrix.ranking_caption: World wide ranking by GAIN Index, higher scores are better.

matrix_delta.name: GAIN Matrix
matrix_delta.description: GDP adjusted GAIN Index scores represent how much better or worse the actual GAIN Index score is from its expected value, based on its GDP. A positive value means a country has a better GAIN Index score than other countries of a similar GDP. A negative value means a country has a worse score.
matrix_delta.ranking_caption: World wide ranking by GAIN Index, higher scores are better.

business.name: Business freedom
business.description: Individual’s right to create, operate, and close an enterprise without interference from the state.

coast_area.name: Coastal area
coast_area.description: Percent of land less than 10 meters above sea-level.

coast_popn.name: Coastal population
coast_popn.description: Percent of population living less than 10 meters above sea-level.

corruption.name: Control of corruption
corruption.description: Perceptions of public power exercised for private gain, including both petty and grand forms of corruption, as well as 'capture' of the state by elites and private interests.

d-ppt.name: Precipitation change
d-ppt.description: Projected change in precipitation by late 21st century, i.e. 2070-99 compared to  1961-90.

source.name: Climatic Research Unit, University of East Anglia. Dataset TYN CY 3.0

d-temp.name: Temperature change
d-temp.description: Projected change in temperature by late 21st century, i.e. 2070-99 compared to  1961-90.

source.name: Climatic Research Unit, University of East Anglia. Dataset TYN CY 3.0

daly.name: Disability adjusted life years
daly.description: Projected percent increase in DALY due to climate change in the late 21st century.

source.name: Adaptation costs for climate change-related cases of diarrhoeal disease, malnutrition, and malaria in 2030, by Kristie L Ebi

dependency_natural.name: Dependency on natural capital
dependency_natural.description: Use of natural capital in national accounting. Specifically natural capital related to ecosystem services: crop, pasture, forest (timber), forest (non-timber) and protected areas. Sub-surface capital such as oil, gas and mineral reserves are not included in this measure for GAIN.

source.name: The Changing Wealth of Nations : Measuring Sustainable Development in the New Millennium. World Bank 2011

ecological_footprint.name: Ecological footprint
ecological_footprint.description: Measures the number of hectares of land and water, both within and outside the country, to supply the average demand on the ecosystems services by the lifestyles of the population of each country. This is compared with the estimated capacity of a country’s ecosystems to regenerate and maintain ecosystem services for either internal use or export. This measure uses the surplus or deficit of capacity to supply over the demand within each country.

electrical_outages.name: Value lost due to electrical outages
electrical_outages.description: Percentage of sale lost due to electrical outages (% of sales).

source.name: World Development Indicators - Value lost due to electrical outages

energy_access.name: Energy access
energy_access.description: Percent population with access to electricity.

energy_sensit.name: Energy sensitivity
energy_sensit.description: Percent of energy derived from hydroelectricity and imported power.

enrollment.name: Tertiary education
enrollment.description: The ratio of total enrollment, regardless of age, to the population in age range for tertiary education.

external.name: External health dependence
external.description: Percent of total expendature devoted to health funds or services in kind that are provided by entities external to the country.

biome_threat.name: Projected Biome Threat
biome_threat.description: The proportion of the land of a country on which the existing biome is no longer matched to the projected climate of the late 21st century.

source.name: Gonzalez, et al. (2010), Global patterns in the vulnerability of ecosystems to vegetation shifts due to climate change. Global Ecology and Biogeography, 19: 755–768. doi: 10.1111/j.1466-8238.2010.00558.x Annex S3
J. Hansen, et al., Global warming in the twenty-first century: An alternative scenario. Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. 97, 9875-9880, doi:10.1073/pnas.170278997 (2000).

finan.name: Financial freedom
finan.description: Banking efficiency, independence from government control and interference in the financial sector.

food_capacity.name: Food capacity
food_capacity.description: Measure of agricultural technological capacity as the average of the 2 best scores from the use of fertilizers, the level of mechanization and the use of irrigation in agriculture.

source.name: World Development Indicators - Fertilizer Consumption (kilograms per hectare of arable land)
World Development Indicators - Agricultural Machinery (tractors per 100 sq. km of arable land)
World Development Indicators - Agricultural Irrigated Land (percent of total agricultural land)

gdp.name: GDP (PPP) per capita
gdp.description: Gross domestic product per capita based on purchasing power parity, in units of constant 2005 international dollar.

gov_spend.name: Government spending
gov_spend.description: Level of government expenditures as a percentage of GDP.

health_disease.name: Disease mortality
health_disease.description: Percentage mortality due to infectious diseases.

imports.name: Food import dependency
imports.description: Proportion of cereal consumption obtained from entities not part of the country in question.

international_treaties.name: International Environmental Conventions
international_treaties.description: The country’s participation in international forums, which is taken as an indicator its capacity to engage in multilateral negotiations and to reach agreement on appropriate actions internally.

invest.name: Investment freedom
invest.description: Constraints on the flow of investment capital. Includes rules for foreign and domestic investment; restrictions on payments, transfers, and capital transactions; labor regulations, corruption, red tape, weak infrastructure, and political and security conditions.

labor.name: Labor freedom
labor.description: Legal and regulatory framework of a country’s labor market.

life.name: Life expectancy
life.description: The number of years a newborn infant would live if prevailing patterns of mortality at the time of its birth were to stay the same throughout its life.

malnutr.name: Malnutrition
malnutr.description: Percent of under 5 year-olds with low weight for their height.

matern.name: Maternal mortality
matern.description: Life time risk of maternal death is the probability that a 15-year-old female will die eventually from a maternal cause assuming that current levels of fertility and mortality (including maternal mortality) do not change in the future, taking into account competing causes of death.

mobiles.name: Mobile penetration
mobiles.description: Mobile telephone subscriptions per 100 people to a public mobile telephone service using cellular technology, which provide access to the public switched telephone network (post-paid and prepaid subscriptions are included).

monetary.name: Monetary freedom
monetary.description: Price stability with an assessment of price controls.

non_violence.name: Political stability & non-violence
non_violence.description: Perceptions of the likelihood that the government will be destabilized or overthrown by unconstitutional or violent means, including domestic violence and terrorism.

protected_biomes.name: Protected biomes
protected_biomes.description: The weighted percentage of biomes under protected status, where the weight is determined by the size of biomes within a country. Countries are not rewarded for protecting beyond 17% of any given biome (i.e., scores are capped at 17% per biome) so that higher levels of protection of some biomes cannot be used to offset lower levels of protection of other biomes.

source.name: Emerson, J.W. et al. 2012: 2012 Environmental Performance Index and Pilot Trend Environmental Performance Index.

road_floods.name: Road flooding
road_floods.description: Frequency of floods calculated as flood disasters per decade per 100,000 km2 of land area.

source.name: World Development Indicators - Land area (sq. km)
EM-DAT: The OFDA/CRED International Disaster Database - Floods.

road_paved.name: Paved roads
road_paved.description: Roads surfaced with crushed stone (macadam) and hydrocarbon binder or bituminized agents, with concrete, or with cobblestones, as a percentage of all the country's roads, measured in length.

rule_of_law.name: Rule of law
rule_of_law.description: Confidence in and abide by the rules of society, and in particular the quality of contract enforcement, property rights, the police, and the courts, as well as the likelihood of crime and violence.

rural_popn.name: Rural population
rural_popn.description: Total rural population as a percent of the total population.

sanit.name: Improved sanitation facilities
sanit.description: The percentage of the population with at least adequate access to excreta disposal facilities that can effectively prevent human, animal, and insect contact with excreta.

source.name: United Nations Indicators - Millenium Development Goals

staff.name: Health workers per capita
staff.description: Number of medical workers per 1000 people, based on (2 x Physicians) + (Nurses and Midwives).

source.name: World Development Indicators - Nurses and midwives (per 1,000 people)

threatened_species.name: Threatened species
threatened_species.description: Composite measure made up of (1) the percentage of mammal species recorded as threatened; (2) the percentage of plant species threatened; and (3) the number of bird species threatened.

trade.name: Trade freedom
trade.description: Absence of tariff and non-tariff barriers that affect imports and exports of goods and services.

trade_transport.name: Trade and transport infrastructure
trade_transport.description: Logistics professionals' perception of country's quality of trade and transport related infrastructure (e.g. ports, railroads, roads, information technology), on a rating ranging from 1 (very low) to 5 (very high). Scores are averaged across all respondents.

source.name: World Development Indicators -  Logistics Performance Index

urban_concentration.name: Urban concentration
urban_concentration.description: Percentage of the country population living in the largest city.

source.name: World Development Indicators - Population in largest city

urban_excess_growth.name: Urban excess growth
urban_excess_growth.description: Excess rate of population growth in urban centres compared with the population growth rate in the whole country (annual %).

source.name: World Development Indicators - Urban population growth
World Development Indicators - Urban population
World Development Indicators - Population growth

urban_risk.name: Urban risk
urban_risk.description: A natural disaster risk index for populations living in large cities (i.e. >0.75M people).

voice_accountability.name: Voice & accountability
voice_accountability.description: Participation in selecting the government, as well as freedom of expression, freedom of association, and a free media.

water_access.name: Water access
water_access.description: The percentage of the population with reasonable access to an adequate amount of water from an improved source, such as a household connection, public standpipe, borehole, protected well or spring, and rainwater collection.

water_disease.name: Water disease
water_disease.description: Water, sanitation & hygiene related deaths per 100,000  children under 5 years old.

water_use.name: Water use
water_use.description: Percent of total internal and external water withdrawn for all uses.

yield_cv.name: Variation of cereal yield
yield_cv.description: Coefficient of variation  (Stdev / mean) of cereal yield per hectare of harvested land, including wheat, rice, maize, barley, oats, rye, millet, sorghum, buckwheat, and mixed grains.

yld_proj.name: Yield change
yld_proj.description: Projected percentage impact of climate change on agricultural yields.

economic.name: Economic
economic.description: Corresponds to 40% of Readiness and equally weights 7 measures related to goverment regulations, taxes and business enabling environment.

governance.name: Governance
governance.description: Corresponds to 30% of Readiness, equally weighting 'Voice and Accountability', government 'Stability' and 'Control of corruption'.

readiness_delta.name: Readiness, adjusted for GDP
readiness_delta.description: GDP adjusted Readiness scores represent how far the actual Readiness score is from its expected value based on its GDP. A positive value means a country has a higher Readiness score than other countries of a similar GDP. A negative value means a country has a worse score.
readiness_delta.map_caption: Countries of the world by Readiness, adjusted for GDP. Higher scores are better.
readiness_delta.ranking_caption: World wide ranking by Readiness, adjusted for GDP. Higher scores are better.

readiness.name: Readiness
readiness.description: A country's GAIN Index score is composed of a Vulnerability score and a Readiness score. Readiness targets those portions of the economy, governance and society that affect the speed and efficiency of absorption and implementation of Adaptation projects.
readiness.map_caption: Countries of the world by Readiness, higher scores are better.
readiness.ranking_caption: World wide ranking by Readiness, higher scores are better.

social.name: Social readiness
social.description: Corresponds to 30% of Readiness. It measures human capital, access to information, communications and working environment.

capacity.name: Capacity
capacity.description: The availability of economic, social, and institutional resources to cope with and adapt to the impacts of climate change in specific sectors. Though related, this differs from readiness indicators in that it seeks to measure the current ability to increase resilience (or reduce vulnerability) in specific sectors, whereas Readiness measures a country’s ability to facilitate further increases in resilience.

ecosystems.name: Ecosystems
ecosystems.description: Ecosystem services are the multitude of processes that humans rely upon to support their lives and livelihoods.
ecosystems.explanation: Ecosystem services are the multitude of processes that humans rely upon to support their lives and livelihoods.  These processes provide food and clean water, regulate the climate, support nutrient cycling and provide cultural experiences.  In developing the GAIN vulnerability measures we have sought to choose sets of measures that are tangible, simple but directly relevant to the concept to be captured.  It is obviously difficult to capture ecosystem services in six simple measures so the use of integrative, synthetic measures was also considered.

exposure.name: Exposure
exposure.description: The nature and degree to which a system is exposed to significant climatic variations.

food.name: Food
food.description: The Food score summarizes a country's food production, nutrition and rural population.

habitat.name: Habitat
habitat.description: Habitat measures the stresses rapid economic, migration and population growth place on human settlements and urban areas.
habitat.explanation:
The urban sector is of particular importance in effective adaptation to a changing climate as it is also the focus of many other social and economic changes.  Internally generated rapid economic and population growth in cities is a challenge in its own right, but it is often exacerbated by substantial migration from rural areas driven as much by the poverty of rural regions as by the attractiveness and opportunities of the cities.  In selecting the measures and in seeking feedback from our technical advisors, we decided to modify our approach to recognize the ‘Human Habitat’ as a 5th life support sector. 
 The measures selected do place more direct emphasis on urban habitats than rural.  However, many rural challenges are already covered in the other life support sectors and increasingly the challenge of the future will be creating sustainable cities in a changing world. Cities are usually the financial, administrative and intellectual hubs of society so disruption to their smooth running has significant flow on effects to the rest of the country.

health.name: Health
health.description: The Health score summarizes a country's ability to provide health services.

infrastructure.name: Infrastructure
infrastructure.description: The Infrastructure score summarizes three factors impacting human well-being: coasts, energy and transportation.

sensitivity.name: Sensitivity
sensitivity.description: The degree to which a system is affected, either adversely or beneficially, by climate variability or change.

vulnerability_delta.name: Vulnerability, adjusted for GDP
vulnerability_delta.description: GDP adjusted Vulnerability scores represent how far the actual Vulnerability score of a country is from its expected Vulnerability score based on its GDP.  A positive value means a country has a higher Vulnerability score than other countries of a similar GDP. A negative value means a country has a worse score.
vulnerability_delta.map_caption: Countries of the world by Vulnerability, adjusted for GDP. Lower scores (green) are better.
vulnerability_delta.ranking_caption: World wide ranking by Vulnerability, adjusted for GDP. Lower scores (green) are better.

vulnerability.name: Vulnerability
vulnerability.description: A country's GAIN Index score is composed of a Vulnerability score and a Readiness score. Vulnerability measures a country's exposure, sensitivity and ability to cope with climate related hazards, as well as accounting for the overall status of food, water, health and infrastructure within the nation.
vulnerability.map_caption: Countries of the world by Vulnerability, lower scores (green) are better.
vulnerability.ranking_caption: World wide ranking by Vulnerability, lower scores (green) are better.

water.name: Water
water.description: The Water score summarizes a country's current and future ability to provide clean water.
